ImageElement.caption: Oakland Raiders former head coach John Madden waves to the crowd after his speech during the Pro Football Hall of Fame ceremonies at Fawcett Stadium in Canton, Ohio, on Aug. 5, 2006. (Bob Larson/Bay Area News Group Archives)
John Madden played football for Cal Poly in 1957 and 1958. (Undated photo/Cal Poly)
John Madden yells at a refs call's in this undated archives photo. (Ron Riesterer/Bay Area News Group Archives)
John Madden stomps the sideline in this undated archives photo. (Ron Riesterer/Bay Area News Group Archives)
John Madden stands in the rain in this 1970 game. (Ron Riesterer/Bay Area News Group Archives)
Daryle Lamonica and John Madden confer on the sidelines during a 1968 game. (Roy H. Williams/Bay Area News Group Archives)
John Madden walks off the field with Jim Otto after a loss for the Raiders in 1971. (Roy H. Williams/Bay Area News Group Archives)
John Madden talks on the sideline with Art Shell in this undated archives photo. (Ron Riesterer/Bay Area News Group Archives)
Oakland Raiders head Coach John Madden watches from the sideline during the 1976 season with the Oakland Raiders. (Dan Rosenstrauch/Bay Area News Group Archives)
Raiders coach John Madden stands on the sidelines with his ever-present field pass in December 1977. (Dino Vournas/Bay Area News Group Archives)

John Madden shoots an Ace Hardware commercial in Benicia, Calif., in June 1997, for a national TV commercial, "Ultimate Tailgate Party," to air during the 1997 NFL football season. (Dan Honda/Bay Area News Group Archives)

Oakland Raiders head coach John Madden stands on the sidelines with quarterback Ken Stabler, center, and running back Mark Van Eeghen during a game at the Oakland Coliseum in the 1976 season. (Dan Rosenstrauch/Bay Area News Group Archives)
Raiders coach John Madden talks with Raiders legend George Blanda, on this Aug. 15, 1970.  (Bay Area News Group Archives)
Raiders quarterback Daryle Lamonica calls for a time out and decision from coach John Madden during a game on Oct. 19, 1970. (Jim Edelen/Bay Area News Group Archives)

Oakland Raiders coach John Madden, flanked by quarterback Ken Stabler, shouts orders to his players on the field on Aug. 27, 1972.  The Raiders defeated the Buffalo Bills 31-13. (Bay Area News Group Archives)
Al Kieselbach of the Oakland Raiders Booster Club presents John Madden with a framed likeness by Oakland Tribune artist Lee Susman on May 8, 1973. (Bill Crouch/Bay Area News Group)

Oakland, CA December 21, 1974 - John Madden is ecstatic as Raiders celebrate a victory against the Miami Dolphins to win the divisional playoffs on Dec. 21, 1974 . (Howard Erker/Bay Area News Group Archives)

Coach John Madden of the Oakland Raiders can't contain himself on the sideline as his star running back, Clarence Davis, races down the field against Minnesota in the Super Bowl in Pasadena, Calif., on Jan. 9, 1977. Free safety Paul Krause of the Vikings comes over to force him out. Oakland won, 32-14. (AP Photo)
Oakland Raiders coach John Madden is carried from the field by his players after his team defeated the Minnesota Vikings in Super Bowl XI in Pasadena, Calif., on Jan. 9, 1977. (AP Photo)
Raiders coach John Madden stands on the sidelines, late afternoon in this photo from December 1977. (Dino Vournas/Bay Area News Group Archives)

John Madden sheds a tear at a news conference on Jan. 4, 1979, in Oakland, Calif., at which he announced he would resign as coach of the Oakland Raiders. "I'm never going to coach again,"  said Madden, who sports a Super Bowl ring, at the news conference.  (AP Photo/James Palmer)
Former NFL coach John Madden gives advice at UC Berkeley on July 26, 1980. (Robert Stinnett/Bay Area News Group Archives)
John Madden takes in a boxing match in Pleasanton, Calif., on Feb. 27, 1987. (Gary Reyes/Bay Area News Group Archives)

Greyhound drivers Leonard Foster, of Chicago;  David Hahn, of Denver; Joseph Williams, of Chesapeake, Va.; Willie Martin, of Winston-Salem, N.C.; Willie Yarbrough, Whittier, Calif; Robert Robinson, of New Orleans;  and Garet Bowling, Pinckard, Ala., compete at the Oakland Coliseum to be the driver of John Madden's "Maddencruiser" on Aug. 7, 1987. (Gary Reyes/Bay Area News Group Archives)

John Madden looks up at a monitor during a test spin of Fox TV's new broadcast setup at San Francisco's Candlestick Park on Aug. 11, 1994. He and Pat Summerall will be the lead announcers for the NFL on Fox TV.  (Karl Mondon/Bay Area News Group Archives)

John Madden chats during a broadcast air station for KCBS  from his Pleasanton-based audio and video production company named Goal Line Productions on Dec. 30, 1998. (Ray Chavez/Bay Area News Group Archives)

NFL Hall of Fame coach, broadcaster John Madden, watches the St. Louis Rams practice at the New Orleans Saints training facility in New Orleans on Feb. 1, 2002.  Madden is in talks with ABC Sports to join "Monday Night Football,'' two TV industry sources told The Associated Press. Madden had one year remaining on his contract with Fox Sports, but the network agreed late Wednesday to free him from that deal, one of the sources said. (AP Photo/Charles Rex Arbogast)
Fox broadcasters Pat Summerall, left, and John Madden stand in the FOX broadcast booth at the Louisiana Superdome before Super Bowl XXXVI on Feb. 3, 2002, in New Orleans. (AP Photo/Ric Feld)

John Madden takes off to cruise around at the third annual Outback Celebrity Golf Classic at Ruby Hill country club in Pleasanton, Calif., to benefit the East Bay Chapter of the Muscular Dystrophy Association on May 6, 2002. (Jay Solmonson/Bay Area News Group Archives)

John Madden recieves some kidding from  Al Michaels about his fear of flying during a recording session in  Pleasanton, Calif., on July 23, 2002. Madden has moved to ABC to team with Michaels on Monday Night  Football. Madden spent most of his broadcasting career at CBS and Fox with  Pat Summerall -- now he's teamed on a new network with a new partner as the three-man Monday Night era comes to a close. (Rick E. Martin/Bay Area News Group Archives)

John Madden and  two sons, Mike  Madden, standing at left, and Joe Madden, right, are photographed inside the Madden Cruiser on Dec. 3, 2002, at Network Associates Coliseum in Oakland, Calif. (Norbert von der Groeben/Bay Area News Group Archives)

Al Michaels and John Madden call the action from the broadcast booth for the most successful and longest-running primetime sports series in television history, returning for its 34th season on the ABC Televison Network. (Craig Sjodin/ABC)

A happy John Madden, former Oakland Raiders head coach, talks about being named as a member of the Pro Football Hall of Fame class of 2006 on Saturday, Feb. 4, 2006 in Detroit. (AP Photo/Mark Humphrey)

Former Oakland Raiders Football Coach John Madden sits still as he is measured for a bronze bust by artist Blair Buswell on April 21, 2006, in Pleasanton, Calif. Madden a local football legend, would be immortalized in the Football Hall of Fame in Ohio. (Susan Tripp Pollard/Bay Area News Group Archives)
John Madden, who will be inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame on August 5, is photographed in his office in Pleasanton, Calif., on Wednesday, July 19, 2006.  (Dean Coppola/Contra Costa Times)

Former Oakland Raiders' head coach John Madden, left, and new head coach Art Shell share a light moment during the first day of training camp for the Oakland Raiders in Napa, Calif. on Tuesday, July 25, 2006. (Dan Honda/Bay Area News Group Staff Archives)

Hall of Fame inductee John Madden waves to the crowd after receiving his yellow jacket from his sons, Mike and Joe Madden, during the enshrinees' dinner in Canton, Ohio,  on Aug. 4, 2006. (Bob Larson/Bay Area News Group Staff Archives)

Oakland Raiders owner Al Davis and Hall of Fame inductee, head coach John Madden, remove the cloth from the bust of Madden during the Pro Football Hall of Fame ceremonies at Fawcett Stadium in Canton, Ohio, on Aug. 5, 2006. (Bob Larson/Bay Area News Group Archives)

Oakland Raiders legend John Madden speaks to fans after he received his Pro Football Hall of Fame ring before the game against the Arizona Cardinals at McAfee Coliseum on Oct. 22, 2006. (Ray Chavez/Bay Area News Group Archives)

In this Jan. 27, 2009, file photo, broadcaster John Madden is photographed at a news conference at the Tampa Convention Center in Tampa, Fla. Madden, the burly former coach who has been one of pro football's most popular broadcast analysts for three decades, is calling it quits. Madden worked for the past three seasons on NBC's Sunday night NFL game. His last telecast was the Super Bowl between Arizona and Pittsburgh.  (AP Photo/St. Petersburg Times, Chris Zuppa, File)

John Madden and Jim Ghielmetti of team ClubSport and Signature Homes discuss strategy during a match at the Madden-Mariucci Charity Bocce Ball Battle of the Bay at Campo di Bocce in Livermore, Calif. on June 1, 2011.  (Jim Stevens/Bay Area News Group Archives)

College of San Mateo Athletics Hall of Fame inductees gather for a photo around a new bronze bulldog after a ribbon cutting ceremony to unveil the school's new Hall of Fame Plaza in San Mateo, Calif., on Friday Sept. 23, 2011. The late San Francisco 49ers football coach Bill Walsh and former Oakland Raiders coach John Madden are among the 16 former College of San Mateo athletes and coaches to be inducted into the school's Hall of Fame. (Anda Chu/Staff)

Former Oakland Raiders head coach John Madden lights a flame to commemorate the spirit of  deceased Raiders owner Al Davis during a halftime tribute, Oct. 16, 2011, at O.co Coliseum in Oakland, Calif. (D. Ross Cameron/Bay Area News Group Archives)

Former Oakland Raiders Head Coach and Pro Football Hall of Famer John Madden, left, and former San Francisco 49ers Head Coach and current NFL Network broadcaster Steve Mariucci joke around as they prepare to kick off the Madden-Mariucci "Battle of the Bay" Charity Bocce Tournament at Campo di Bocce facility in Livermore, Calif., on June 6, 2012. Since its inception back in 1999, this event has raised nearly $3.5 million for local and national charities. (Anda Chu/Staff)

Former Oakland Raiders head coach and Pro Football Hall of Famer John Madden keeps an eye on the action at the Madden-Mariucci "Battle of the Bay" Charity Bocce Tournament at Campo di Bocce facility in Livermore, Calif., on June 6, 2012. Since its inception back in 1999, this event has raised nearly $3.5 million for local and national charities. (Anda Chu/Staff)
